p: ARDS is a clinical entity characterized by progressive bilateral pulmonary infiltrates that cannot be fully explained by cardiac disease or volume overload. Despite advances on the understanding of this condition, mortality remains significant [ 12]. Management involves lung-protective ventilation, prone positioning, corticosteroids, paralytics and ECMO. The use of corticosteroids is controversial, with data showing that high dose of steroids fails to improve mortality and might cause harm [ 13, 14]. On the other hand, the CESAR trial showed improved survival on ECMO compared to conservative management with medium duration of cannulation of 9 days [ 15]. Our patient was started on high dose methylprednisolone along with ECMO support, given the improvement on her respiratory status she was decannulated after 4 days.
